intro: Spermacoce membranacea, commonly known as the membranous spiderling, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce membranacea is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
